page.title: 01GENERAL BACKGROUND.
page.content: The block is situated just to the south of the City of Ely in Cambridgeshire. Cambridge is about 12 miles to the south, Newmarket about 15 miles to the east and London 75 miles to the south. The area is sparsely populated containng two small villages Stuntney and Little Thetford with a few isolated farms. The relief is low lying (some areas being below sea level) with just two areas of 'high' ground reaching about 20 metres above sea level. The climate is of a 'continental type' with warm, dry summers and cold winters. The main occupations in the area are agriculturally based with farming being the most important. Other types of industry are rare.
